channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Couple die in agony after home brewing their own lockdown beer
item.description: South African couple Tony Hilliar, 54, and Alida Fouche, 42,died after making their own illicit supply of beer to get around their country's strict alcohol ban imposed since the Covid-19 lockdown.

item.title: Bunting everywhere! MailOnline readers share brilliant pictures of VE Day lockdown celebrations
item.description: MailOnline readers celebrated the 75th anniversary of VE Day by making delicious afternoon teas and joining their neighbours for driveway street parties amid lockdown.

item.title: Alan Sugar advertises stunning Florida mansion for sale for $13million
item.description: What better way to sell a lavish, multi-million pound stateside property than by taking to social media to show it off in front of the masses? That was the choice of Lord Sugar, who promoted the plush crib.

item.title: Wifelets at war!
item.description: The passing of one of Britain's most colourful aristocrats last month has cast a pall of sorrow across the Longleat estate, where they are mourning for the late Marquess of Bath.

item.title: Winston Churchill's granddaughter reveals her mother's mercy dash
item.description: On the evening of May 8, 1945, Winston Churchill could have been forgiven a little merry-making.

item.title: Tekashi 69 breaks Instagram record with 2M viewers of his livestream after release from jail
item.description: Tekashi 69 just broke the record for Instagram Live viewers as he broadcast an epic rant on Friday after his release from jail.

item.title: Adele shows off dramatic weight loss and ALISON BOSHOFF reveals how she picked her look from pals
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: Adele, 32 this week, posed for stunning photos in which her 10 st weight loss was evident. So what is behind her makeover, and who's in the glam squad behind her transformation?

item.title: Glorious sun on the home front for VE Day
item.description: London's parks were filled with groups of sunbathers and other revellers on Friday as the bank holiday sunshine saw the public flout lockdown rules once again. In Clapham (pictured) groups were seen gathering.

item.title: 'Two thirds of coronavirus cases in Britain are going undiagnosed'
item.description: Professor Tim Spector, a leading genetic epidemiologist, said the failure to class common symptoms in with the dry cough and fever has led to statisticians collecting data which is 'nonsense'.

item.title: Boston Dynamics' 'Spot' robotic dog deployed in Singapore to remind people to keep a safe distance
item.description: Spot will traverse a 4-mile swath of Bishan-Ang Mo Kio Park during off-peak hours while playing a recorded message that reminds park-goers 'observe safe distancing measures.'

item.title: Commuters could be made to book slots at train stations using smartphone app to stop overcrowding
item.description: Commuters on Britain's railways may have to book allotted times to travel to stop overcrowding once coronavirus lockdown measures start to ease. Rail operators are said to be considering a new app.

item.title: Families queue along the street outside Italian pawn shops
item.description: Affide pawn shop, one of the largest pledge lenders in the country, said it has had to extend its opening hours after seeing a 30 per cent increase in customers since Italy lifted some of its lockdown on Monday.

item.title: Google mobility data shows people are flocking to parks during sunny weather
item.description: At a coronavirus pandemic press briefing at Downing Street today, Medical Director for NHS England Professor Stephen Powis shared data showing the public's movements for the first time.

item.title: Gogglebox pays tribute to June Bernicoff after her death aged 82
item.description: Viewers were moved to tears when Gogglebox dedicated Friday's episode to June, after her death aged 82. Many of the show's stars also paid tribute on social media.

item.title: Travellers will be quarantined for TWO WEEKS and face £1,000 fines if they break rules
item.description: The Prime Minister will say that passengers arriving at UK ports and airports from all countries except Ireland, and including Britons, will be forced to self-isolated for 14 days.

item.title: Hospitals probed after sending elderly back to care homes despite KNOWING they had coronavirus
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The elderly patients sent back from hospitals, despite suffering from coronavirus, triggered outbreaks in care homes, tragically claiming the lives of other vulnerable residents.

item.title: Unions threaten to scupper plans to reopen schools by June 1
item.description: Government sources have indicated Boris Johnson wants schools to begin to reopen on June 1, although unions have expressed concern about safety. TUC's Frances O'Grady is pictured.

item.title: Italy becomes first EU country to record more than 30,000 deaths after 243 die from coronavirus
item.description: The Italian Health Ministry registered 243 deaths on Friday, bringing the total of those who died in the country to 30,201. Authorities said many more likely to have died with infection at home.

item.title: JOHN HUMPHRYS: An asteroid could be heading for Earth and yet our leaders are at war with each other
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: Every leader of every country in the world had come together on a virtual network. Never had there been such a conference. But, yet, never had there been such a crisis.

item.title: Cars of the future could use 5G to 'talk' to each other, scientists claim
item.description: Experts at Glasgow Caledonian University (GCU) believe the high-speed connection will also improve the reliability and capability of automated vehicles.

item.title: Expert calls for protocols to keep alien viruses from infecting Earth after humans visit Mars
item.description: Stanford professor Scott Hubbard said in an interview that NASA must adopt 'planetary protection' to keep alien viruses from returning from the human Mars mission and contaminating Earth.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 13, wins court fight forcing Oxfordshire council to scrap transgender 'toilets toolkit'
item.description: Oxfordshire County Council introduced the advice for transgender pupils last year, saying they should be able to use the toilets of their identified gender. The council has withdrawn the advice.

item.title: Bail-out billions anaesthetise us from reality but our economy is in tatters
item.description: DR JOHN LEE: The survival of the British economy, the very future of our society and the hopes of generations to come will depend upon Boris Johnson's words.

item.title: Joan Collins and Geri Horner lead stars in nationwide singalong for VE Day
item.description: The 86-year-old cut a very stylish figure as she sang her lines to camera as part of a video compilation created by the Royal British Legion, which was released on Tuesday.

item.title: UK commemorates VE Day 75 years on in lockdown celebrations
item.description: The nation will come together today to commemorate the 75th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day, and remember those who fought and died in the Second World War.

item.title: Phillip Schofield poses with family for a murder mystery night
item.description: The This Morning star, 58, posed for a fun photo at his Oxfordshire family home with wife Stephanie and daughters Ruby, 24, and Molly, 27.

item.title: VE Day 75: UK sings along to Vera Lynn's 'We'll Meet Again'
item.description: Brits joined together on Friday night to sing Dame Vera Lynn's We'll Meet Again. Voices rang out up and down the country to mark 75 years since the end of the Second World War in Europe.

item.title: Queen surrounded by wartime mementos for VE Day speech
item.description: On the desk in front of the Queen was her Auxiliary Territorial Service (ATS) khaki-coloured peaked cap - part of her uniform when she undertook National Service as a teenage princess in February 1945.

item.title: PLATELL'S PEOPLE: Vulgar LA mansion is a stain on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex
item.description: AMANDA PLATELL: We learned that they have chosen as their LA hideaway, a Tuscan-style mansion amid 14 acres in a gated community in one of the most sought-after areas of Hollywood....

item.title: Netherlands schools will have plastic screens fitted on desks as they begin to reopen next week
item.description: Dutch schools have been closed since March 14 and will reopen on May 11. Teachers at the Springplank in Den Bosch say they 'are not worried'. There have been 5,359 deaths in the country.

item.title: Garden centres OPEN: Customers will return next week as the lockdown eases
item.description: Garden centres will be allowed to reopen next week under Boris Johnson's plans to ease the lockdown.

item.title: Man, 57, is arrested on suspicion of murder after body of woman in her 40s is found in a flat
item.description: The victim, a woman in her 40s, was found in the property in Reigate, Surrey shortly before 7am on Friday. Officers confirmed that the victim's next of kin have been informed about her death.

item.title: Children exposed to sexual abuse images on zoom
item.description: The app, which has surged in popularity in lockdown, has been urged to tighten security as children's charity the NSPCC warned of a 'growing trend' of Zoom calls being infiltrated.

item.title: Queen's VE Day 75th Anniversary speech praises lockdown spirit
item.description: Her Majesty spoke from Windsor Castle at 9pm today as she celebrated the everyday heroism of the wartime generation and the British people battling coronavirus during the national crisis.

item.title: Google and Facebook extend work-from-home plans until 2021 to protect employees from coronavirus
item.description: Google and Facebook have told most employees to keep working from home for the rest of the year as part of a response by the tech giants to the deadly coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The Mail reveals it's a female former friend suing Duke and Duchess of York for a £6.7m unpaid debt
item.description: The original owner, said to be a female beneficiary of a trust fund, is believed to have sold Chalet Helora to the Yorks in 2014 for 22m Swiss francs (£18m). They owe her £6.7m and she decided to go to court.

item.title: Ahmaud Arbery murder: Arrested ex-cop investigated him before
item.description: Brunswick District Attorney Jackie Johnson blocked police from arresting a father and son for the murder of black jogger Ahmaud Arbery, 25, because one of them used to work on her office.

item.title: Now a member of Mike Pence's staff tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence's spokesperson Katie Miller, who also serves as a spokesperson for the White House Coronavirus Task Force, tested positive for the coronavirus..

item.title: Donald Trump denies involvement in botched coup led by Green Beret friend of his ex-bodyguard
item.description: President Donald Trump once again denying any involvement in a botched coup operation in Venezuela, saying if he new about it it would have been an 'invasion.'

item.title: Satellite images reveal fleets of empty cruise ships clustering together in Caribbean & Philippines
item.description: At least three groups of cruise ships, with 15 in total, are clustered together off Coco Cay and Great Stirrup Cay in the Bahamas and about 12 are off the coast of Manila, in the Philippines.

item.title: Doctors at hospital's children's unit fix cartoons to their masks to reassure young patients
item.description: Staff working in the children's Panda Unit at Salford Royal came up with the innovative way to reassure young patients after fearing they could be spooked by the medics' concealed faces in PPE.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton chat to veterans on VE Day
item.description: Prince William, 37, and Kate Middleton, 38, made a video call to residents of an East Sussex care home on Wednesday. They giggled as the WWII veterans shared their VE Day memories.

item.title: The most fitting of fly-pasts marks VE Day after Mail made the Spitfire tour possible
item.description: Although all general aviation remains out of bounds during the pandemic, the Daily Mail was granted an exemption by Transport Secretary Grant Shapps to see spitfires take to the skies.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry flown on private jet to LA
item.description: Tyler Perry sent his private jet to whisk Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to LA in a top secret, early morning enterprise on March 14, DailyMail.com has learned exclusively.

item.title: Serena Williams poses for stunning Stuart Weitzman campaign
item.description: Mother-of-one Serena, 38, stars in a striking black-and-white campaign that was shot in Palm Beach in February, before the COVID-19 pandemic pushed many people into lockdown.

item.title: Katherine Jenkins sings to an empty Albert Hall as defiant Brits celebrate VE Day
item.description: The songbird performed classic anthems including We'll Meet Again and The White Cliffs of Dover for 30 minutes behind closed doors for the first time in the venue's 150-year history.

item.title: Working from home DOES increase productivity, according to a survey
item.description: Survey asked individuals how they have adapted since shifting from the office to their home amid the coronavirus pandemic and one-third said they are more productive than when in the office.

item.title: ROBERT HARDMAN: The Queen has once again lifted the nation during this very different war
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: Reminding us of the central message of VE Day itself, the Queen declared: 'Never give up, never despair.'

item.title: FDA gives emergency authorization for first-ever coronavirus test using the gene-editing tool CRISPR
item.description: The new coronavirus test uses a CRISPR molecule that can find viral RNA instead of human DNA, in nose and throat samples, and glows when it's been found due to a fluorescent marker.

item.title: US death toll would be HALF of what is if stay-at-home orders came four days sooner
item.description: If stay-at-home orders in the US had been issued just four days earlier, new coronavirus cases would fall from 30,000 to 10,000 per day and deaths would fall from 2,000 to 1,000 per day.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: Should I walk away from my lazy, toxic brother?
item.description: This week Bel advises a reader who doesn't know whether to walk away from her lazy, toxic brother.

item.title: UFC 249 aims to provide road map for sports' return
item.description: UFC fighters stopped social distancing by hugging and shaking hands at Friday's weigh-in ahead of Saturday's fight card - the first major North American sporting event since the pandemic began.

item.title: Craig Revel Horwood tells why he decides to wed again
item.description: The Strictly star said he knew Jonathon was the one on their first date and decided to marry again after Jonathon helped him plant a garden to remember the love he had for his father.

item.title: PPE pirates shamelessly buy up vital safety gear and ramp up prices for NHS and carers
item.description: Shameless opportunists are buying up supplies of personal protective equipment and hiking prices by as much as 10,000 times, a Mail investigation has found.

item.title: Disney World to reopen restaurants and entertainment areas with COVID-19 safety measures this month
item.description: Walt Disney World plans to reopen its restaurant and entertainment areas with coronavirus safety measures later this month, though the theme parks and hotels will remain closed.

item.title: Human laboratory that could defeat coronavirus
item.description: Retired teacher Beverley Attwood lives with her husband Bob in a picturesque cottage festooned with VE Day bunting in Brighstone, one of the prettiest villages on the Isle of Wight.

item.title: Rod Stewart, 74, reveals he's got FOUR children living with him in lockdown
item.description: The singer-songwriter made an appearance on The One Show on Friday as part of the celebrations to mark VE Day.

item.title: Australian business launches infrared sauna blankets
item.description: The Australian MiHIGH product allows customers to enjoy the benefits of an infrared sauna in the comfort of their own home and bed.

item.title: The best holiday homes to book for a post-lockdown break with family and friends from Italy to Wales
item.description: All of us are dreaming of the days when families can enjoy real, not virtual, time together. Here are some of the best options in the UK and abroad where you can do just that once restrictions are lifted.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Lockdown eased for cleaners pre-exit strategy
item.description: Guidance slipped out earlier this week states that domestic helpers 'can continue work' in people's homes, 'providing that you are well and have no symptoms'.

item.title: The Queen recalls 'happiness and relief' of VE Day in interview
item.description: In an unearthed interview shared on the Royal Family's Instagram page today, the Queen, 93, recalled being 'swept along on a tide of happiness' during VE Day celebrations in London.

item.title: German towns bring back lockdown after coronavirus spike
item.description: The regional government in North Rhine-Westphalia, said there had been a spike in coronavirus cases after 150 of 1,200 employees tested positive at a slaughterhouse in Coesfeld.

item.title: Coronavirus: Scientists estimate it kills 0.75% of all patients
item.description: Researchers from Australia compared 13 studies of numbers of people killed by the coronavirus and suggested a 0.75 per cent death rate, and a range of 0.45-1.01 was reasonable.

item.title: Teacher who saved children in Aberfan disaster dies at 86
item.description: Schoolteacher Rennie Williams who led many pupils to safety during the Aberfan disaster has died age 86. She helped children escape as a coal tip engulfed Pantglas Junior School in 1966.

item.title: A nation remembers: Donald Trump marks 75 years since VE Day ended World War II
item.description: Trump and the first lady laid a wreath at the national memorial to the fallen of the war in the National Mall, Washington D.C. Eight veterans, the youngest 96, had traveled to be there.

item.title: RAF veteran, 101, dies on eve of 75th anniversary of VE Day
item.description: Battle of Britain veteran Terry Clark died just hours before VE Day, leaving one surviving member of 'The Few' who protected Britain from Nazi Germany in 1940.

item.title: Justice Department is DROPPING case against Mike Flynn for lying to the FBI
item.description: Speaking before attending a National Day of Prayer Ceremony with his wife, Trump claimed the prosecution of his first national security adviser was a 'plot to take down a president' by 'scum.'

item.title: Father, 40, is charged with murdering his two children
item.description: Nadarajah Nithiyakumar, 40, of Ilford was charged with the murder of his two children, Pavinya, 19 months, and three-year-old Nigish following an attack on April 26.

item.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins host Ant Middleton's wife crashed £200,000 Lamborghini Huracan on shopping trip
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Emilie Middleton, 40, span off the road near their home in Great Leighs, Chelmsford, Essex and ended up with the super charged yellow Lamborghini Huracan buried in a hedge.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government created climate of fear, says expert
item.description: Professor Robert Dingwall said Britain had 'completely lost sight' of the true nature of the disease because 'mostly it isn't' killing people.

item.title: Joan Collins, 86, celebrates VE Day 75th anniversary on balcony
item.description: Joan Collins looked sensational as she quaffed champagne on her Union Jack bedecked balcony to commemorate the 75th anniversary of VE Day on Friday.

item.title: 'Potentially fatal' heat and humidity are occurring around the world due to global warming
item.description: A damning study found global warming is driving temperatures and humidity to levels exceeding what the human body can deal with.

item.title: Prince Edward, Sophie Wessex and Princess Anne video call veterans
item.description: Earlier this week, and ahead of VE Day today, Sophie Wessex, 55, Prince Edward, 56, and Princess Anne, all telephoned several veterans to learn about their experiences in the war.

item.title: Housebuyers plan rural retreat after lockdown as estate agents see surge of enquiries
item.description: Estate agents Rightmove and Savills have reported a noticeable rise in the number of prospective homebuyers looking to move to remote coastal areas across the UK.

item.title: Covidiot trio spark 45-man coast guard rescue operation after getting cut off by the tide
item.description: Police and coastguard helicopters were scrambled after the trio, who were walking along the foot of the cliffs yesterday, then ran into trouble in the sea.

item.title: Bear, bath and beyond: Ten-year-old bear Takoda enjoys splashing around in a tub at the Oregon Zoo
item.description: Video footage shows a 10-year-old bear named Takoda at the Oregon Zoo when he was caught splashing around and playing with a wooden block inside a 300-gallon tub of cool water.

item.title: How London's famous landmarks looked on VE Day in 1945 compared to eerie quiet of 2020
item.description: As nearly six years of conflict came to an end in Europe, millions of Britons took the streets of London to celebrate with street parties, music and dancing into the night

item.title: Government advisers' fury as criticisms blanked out of documents
item.description: Members of SPI-B, an independent pandemic advisory group that works with government officials, said their criticisms of badly thought out policies had been blanked out of public documents.

item.title: Stunning 'lucky' image of Jupiter turns the gas giant into a 'jack-o-lantern'
item.description: It is a mosaic formed from three years' worth of 'lucky images' taken by the Gemini telescope in Hawaii and is one of the clearest photos of Jupiter ever taken from Earth.

item.title: Met Police drops investigation into pro-Brexit campaigners' spending during EU referendum
item.description: Cases against two prominent pro-Brexit campaigners have been dropped by Met Police. Darren Grimes was fined in 2018 for breaching spending rules in 2016, but won an appeal in January this year.

item.title: Minister: McDonald's, KFC and Burger King did not need to shut during outbreak
item.description: Food Secretary George Eustice said the government had never 'explicitly mandated' that takeaways had to close.

item.title: Scotland's care home coronavirus crisis has killed 1,000 people in three weeks
item.description: Data from the National Records of Scotland reveals the country is showing first signs of outbreak tapering off but more than 300 people are still dying every week in care homes.

item.title: Woman left looking like a 'monster' after her thug childhood sweetheart smashed her head in
item.description: Lisa O'Malley (pictured), 33, from Peterborough was at home when her ex-boyfriend Jonathon Youthed, 32, arrived covered in blood and 'bragging' about assaulting another man.

item.title: The world faces 'mega-famines' that could 'impact us on biblical proportions' due to coronaviruS
item.description: The United Nations' World Food Programme has cautioned that the world faces famines if enough funds are not pledged to combat the effects of the virus in the world's most fragile countries.

item.title: Human brains use dreams to replay recent events and help form memories, study finds
item.description: Using implanted electrodes, US researchers were able to show that people's brains replayed the neuron activity of a memory game while they slept.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll tops 31,000 with hundreds of new fatalities
item.description: Environment Secretary George Eustice revealed the figures, which include fatalities in all settings, at tonight's Downing Street press briefing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Vitamin D deficient are TWICE as likely to die
item.description: A study from the US found patients with a severe deficiency are twice as likely to experience major complications, including death.

item.title: George Eustice announces £16m food charity cash injection
item.description: Food Secretary George Eustice today announced a £16 million charity cash injection in a bid to make sure the most vulnerable in society do not go hungry during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: VE Day: Red Arrows pay tribute on 75th anniversary with flypast
item.description: Footage shot from inside a cockpit by Red Arrows photographer Corporal Adam Fletcher captures an aerial view of the team soaring over Buckingham Palace and the London Eye to mark VE Day.

item.title: Hungarian doctor, 65, who failed English test six times, keeps his job
item.description: Dr Gyorgy Rakoczy, pictured, has been allowed to resume practice despite having problems with English which led him to inject a four-year-old child with a potentially fatal dose of carbolic acid.

item.title: Haunting images by Romain Veillon of France's last panopticon jail in Autun
item.description: They were taken by French photographer Romain Veillon inside the city of Autun jail, which has a design much-dreaded among prisoners - panopticon. It has been abandoned since 1956.

item.title: Third of Britons put on weight during lockdown due to drop in physical activity
item.description: A poll of 2,000 adults found those who have increased in weight have put on an average of six lbs during recent weeks, with the typical adult now averaging half an hour less exercise.

item.title: Banana bread tops the list of most searched for recipes in lockdown
item.description: The 'Brilliant banana loaf' tops a list of the website's most-searched for recipes between March 23, when Boris Johnson put the country into lockdown, and April 30, followed by chocolate brownies.

item.title: Coronation Street's Colson Smith STUNS fans with his weight loss transformation
item.description: The actor stunned fans when he unveiled his staggering weight loss transformation on Instagram on Friday.

item.title: Swedish Covid-19 expert says lockdowns are merely delaying inevitable
item.description: Johan Giesecke, who was Sweden's top virus expert for 10 years, believes lockdowns are merely delaying an inevitable wave of coronavirus cases and deaths - not preventing it.

item.title: NHS will have 'answers' on whether experimental coronavirus drugs work by JUNE
item.description: Stephen Powis, NHS England's national medical director, said the first results of clinical trials - testing drugs like hydroxychloroquine -are expected in 'five to seven weeks'.

item.title: Cat is euthanised after becoming first in Spain to catch coronavirus
item.description: The four-year-old feline contracted the killer bug in Catalonia and was taken to a veterinary hospital with breathing difficulties. He was put to sleep and his body sent to a hospital for research.

item.title: Simon Cowell moved to tears by 'miracle' dog that performs magic tricks on BGT
item.description: The animal lover, 60, was close to breaking down as Miracle the dog stole the show with a magic trick on an episode of Britain's Got Talent.

item.title: British woman, 22, expresses concern that she is a controlling relationship
item.description: A British wonan, 22, took to Mumsnet for advice, revealing that her boyfriend caring, but she's worried he might be controling after red flags, such as saying her best friend is a 'bad influence'.

item.title: Woman creates shaker doors at home for only £40
item.description: Kim Burns from Gloucestershire refused to pay a hefty price to have new doors installed, and told the Extreme Couponing and Bargains UK Facebook group how she made her own.

item.title: Deceptively difficult emoji quiz puts your knowledge of capital cities to the test
item.description: Nikki Spiers, 31, who lives in London, is known for creating social media's viral emoji quizzes. She has posted a new challenge, asking puzzlers to name 20 capital cities using emojis.

item.title: Gurkhas rescue 109 stranded British tourists stuck in remote parts of Nepal
item.description: Soldiers, UK embassy staff and drivers travelled more than 4,000 miles through the mountains, negotiating river crossing and landslides, during the three-week rescue mission.

item.title: Leading sexual health clinic says HIV transmission has 'dropped dramatically'
item.description: London sexual health clinic 56 Dean Street released a statement urging people to get tested, saying that if new cases are picked up now it can reduce transmission when lockdown ends.

item.title: Britain's airport FARCE summed up in one photo
item.description: Both Heathrow and BA have provided masks to their staff, but say they are following government guidance, which does not mandate mask-wearing.

item.title: Outspoken sister-of-the bride SLAMS her gown for being 'too booby' in Say Yes To The Dress
item.description: Fashionista Jenny is on the search for her dream gown in tonight's Say Yes To The Dress Lancashire. But her sister Jilly leaves Gok gobsmacked when she says one dress is 'too booby.'

item.title: Prince Charles and Camilla lead VE Day 75th anniversary tributes
item.description: Camilla, 72, paid tribute to her father Major Bruce Shand when she joined her husband Prince Charles, 71, to lay flowers at the war memorial at Balmoral Castle, Aberdeenshire today.

item.title: Three ingredient fudge is the latest lockdown baking trend to takeover Instagram
item.description: Eloise Head, from London, who shares her recipes on Instagram and TikTok under the name FitWaffle , has reached more than 50 million people with three recipes showing simple ways to make fudge.

item.title: WHO says live animal markets should NOT be closed, despite coronavirus links to Wuhan market
item.description: The WHO has said markets selling live animals should not be forced to closed down - despite widespread belief that coronavirus first spread from a Wuhan wet market.

item.title: Family receive poison pen letter over VE Day Union flags
item.description: Nicola and Mark Slater received the anonymous letter yesterday after decorating the outside of their home in Lawley, Shropshire, with bunting and flags to mark the 75th anniversary of VE Day.

item.title: Trains will return to running at 70% of normal timetable in 10 days
item.description: TfL, who operate London's underground network, are 'running the maximum frequency' of services possible. Fewer trains means commuters have been forced to cram into over-crowded carriages.

item.title: Shocking moment police Taser father in front of his screaming child at petrol station
item.description: Disturbing footage shows two officers bringing the man to the ground as his son watches on in Manchester on Wednesday night.

item.title: A record 150 migrants are picked up in English Channel trying to get to UK in last 24 hours
item.description: The first boat with 50 migrants is understood to have been picked up off Kent at around 2am today. Conditions were perfect for crossing with calm seas, good visibility and a full moon.

item.title: Bomber Command hero who completed 48 missions by the age of 21 dies just weeks before VE Day
item.description: Flight Sergeant Robert 'Bob' Gill, from London, was awarded the Distinguished Flying Medal for his role in the Allied bombing campaign against Berlin's war machine.

item.title: Speeded-up LNER cab ride footage of a train travelling from Edinburgh to London in SIX MINUTES
item.description: For those missing travelling around Britain - here's a way to see hundreds of miles of it in mere minutes. LNER has released speeded-up footage of a journey from Edinburgh to Kings Cross.

item.title: Teachers warn of 'ghost schools' after coronavirus lockdown
item.description: A plan for the phased reopening of schools is expected to be announced by Boris Johnson when he unveils his lockdown exit strategy on Sunday.

item.title: Ash dieback disease plaguing British forests could be stopped by hedgerows
item.description: Scientists from the British Ecological Society found the fungal disease is far less severe in the isolated landscapes such as in hedgerows.

item.title: Woman, 27, dropped six dress sizes by swapping takeaways for homemade meals
item.description: Jade Wyles, 27, from Nottinghamshire, felt body confident, but was left devastated after her date told a mutual friend that he wasn't interested in seeing her again because of her 19st 7lb frame.

item.title: UK 'outlier' for not having coronavirus border controls, says Nicola Sturgeon adviser
item.description: Professor Devi Sridhar said most countries had imposed rules on arrivals such as a 14-day quarantine to avoid fuelling the deadly disease.

item.title: Snake and vac! Reptile named Luna needed lube before vets could free her from vacuum pipe
item.description: This is the moment vets had to pull out a snake from a vacuum tube after it had squeezed into the pipe while the owner was tidying up.

item.title: No, I said SHOO! Lioness chews on a ranger's BOOT after pride surrounded his tent in South Africa
item.description: Norman Chauke, 28, from Makuleke Limpopo, South Africa, works as a tracking instructor at a reserve - and was stunned when the lions decided they wanted to chew on the boots he'd left outside the tent.

item.title: Ghana's famous dancing pallbearers share message thanking coronavirus doctors around the world
item.description: The video, shared online by lead pallbearer Benjamin Aidoo, shows the seven men dressed head-to-toe in white, complete with gloves and face masks as they applaud doctors.

item.title: The 24-person Triton submarine with huge windows that will take tourists to depths of up to 328ft
item.description: The vessel is made by Florida-based Triton Submarines, which built the Limiting Factor submersible that made a record-breaking dive to the bottom of the Mariana Trench last year.

item.title: Woman whose flight was diverted after going into labour 10 weeks early is back in UK with son
item.description: Lauren McLean gave birth to Oscar in the most traumatic circumstances at the beginning of March and her ordeal only ended when they flew back home to Birmingham at the end of April.

item.title: How to make Papa Johns Garlic Knots at home:
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The pizza delivery chain has revealed to Femail how to make its popular Garlic Knots in 10 easy steps if you are after a new baking challenge for the Bank Holiday weekend.

item.title: Germany bans 'gay conversion therapy' for under-18s
item.description: German Health Minister Jens Spahn, who is openly gay, announced the passage of a law which makes it illegal to promote a service designed to change or suppress sexuality to young people.

item.title: Prehistoric sea creature that lived 250million years ago evolved pebble-shaped teeth
item.description: The unique adaptation was spotted in a fossil of the smallest known ichthyosaurs, called Cartorhynchus lenticarpus.
item.media:description: A reconstruction of what Cartorhynchus may have looked like in life (Stefano Broccoli)

item.title: Vintage railway posters given redesigns asking tourists to stay away when Covid lockdown eases
item.description: York's National Railway Museum (NRM) has published the set of 10 images covering scenic locations such as Cornwall, the Norfolk Broads and the Yorkshire coast.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton share a throwback snap of the Queen as they celebrate VE Day
item.description: Prince William, 37, and Kate Middleton, 38, shared a series of black-and-white photographs of crowds celebrating VE Day in London, including one of the Queen, 93, as she worked as a mechanic.

item.title: BBC Sport boss defends 'cull' of veteran broadcasters
item.description: The BBC's head of television sport Philip Bernie's comments came after the departures of several veteran presenters such as John Inverdale, 62, led to accusations of a 'cull'.

item.title: Savvy mum transforms her garden using paint from Wilko and solar lights from B&M
item.description: Amy Mycock, 29, from Stoke-on-Trent, told latestdeals.co.uk how she transformed her garden for £429, after her children said they'd rather have a hot tub than the trampoline they rarely used.

item.title: Russian billionaire found dead in his gym was murdered, his sons claim
item.description: The body of Dmitry Bosov, 52, who played ice hockey with Vladimir Putin, was discovered by his wife with a gunshot wound to his head in a 'suspected suicide' at his Moscow mansion.

item.title: Covid-19 has unleashed a 'tsunami of hate', UN chief warns
item.description: Antonio Guterres urged world leaders to 'immunize our societies against the virus of hate' as warned that minorities including Muslims and Jews are being scapegoated over coronavirus.

item.title: Brazil is facing 'economic collapse' due to its coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Paulo Guedes warned yesterday that business leaders are telling him there is a danger production may seize up leading to food shortages. Brazil has recorded 9,146 coronavirus deaths.

item.title: Grimes gives fans a tutorial on how to pronounce bizarre name of son she shares with Elon Musk
item.description: The Oblivion singer, 32, was rather terse in explaining the unusual moniker in her response to a question asking 'how do you pronounce the baby's name?' on Instagram.

item.title: Diamond doggy! Can YOU spot the dachshund with an engagement ring hanging from its collar?
item.description: British jewellery manufacturers Purely Diamonds has created a baffling new brainteaser, where players are asked to spot which dog is wearing an engagement ring around its collar.

item.title: Warren Jeffs accuser opens up on life in the polygamist cult
item.description: Rebecca Musser, 44, is opening up on life in the polygamist cult run by church leader Warren Jeffs, 64, in Utah and how she helped bring him down.

item.title: Life on the ocean wave was a floating HELL!
item.description: Stephen Taylor examines the 'heroic age of sail' in a fascinating new book. The British author reveals how more sailors died from fever and accidents, than in war.

item.title: Counter-terrorism sniffer dogs Mick and Mack are trained to root out destructive Japanese knotweed
item.description: Labrador retrievers Mack and Mick are thought to be the first dogs in the UK trained to sniff out Japanese knotweed in both homes and gardens and will freeze when they identify the plant.

item.title: White red squirrel spotted enjoying a spot of breakfast
item.description: A rare white red squirrel has been spotted having breakfast in a garden in Perthshire. Chris Eddington photographed the rare mammal in at his home in Dunkeld and told a Scottish squirrel monitoring group.

item.title: Big nap and fries: Adorable moment toddler struggles to stay awake as he eats his dinner
item.description: Toddler Conor Rees was finishing a meal of fries, chicken nuggets and beans at home in Dublin, Ireland when he was struck by a bout of tiredness.

item.title: Mosquitoes that can carry diseases could be common in Europe by 2030
item.description: The insect, known by the scientific name Aedes aegypti as well as the common name 'yellow fever mosquito', currently only thrives in the world's hottest regions.

item.title: Hundreds of non-recyclable fiberglass wind turbine blades are pictured piling up in landfill
item.description: The municipal landfill in Casper, Wyoming, is the repository of at least 870 discarded blades, and one of the few locations in the country that accepts the massive fiberglass objects.

item.title: Video shows a professional surfer's daring ride down a storm drain in Hawaii
item.description: Professional surfer Jamie O'Brien posted the stellar video to YouTube in April, showing him and his friends surfing down a storm drain in Hawaii.
